title: 820-00138a no green light
message:
I have this 820-00138a, which came in, if I use fake charger, it can  have green light but disappear and reappear every few second, i have tried replacing q7180 and  with known good from my own board, i have replaced r7180, r7185 with correct value (100k and 470k)
I have replaced f7005, and q7010 too.., i have 0.474 volt on f7005 when original magsage 85w plugged in..

title: 820-00138a no green light
message:
Usually Q/D7010 issue.
Post first exact value of R7012; measured onboard, ohm scale.

title: 820-00138a no green light
message:
I have changed q7010, d7010 not shorted
R7012 : 21,6 k ohm

title: 820-00138a no green light
message:
What happens with PPBUS_G3H and 3V42_G3H with fake charger?
Check for short on all secondary coils.
Also check output voltages from pages 64/66.

Did you try to start in SMC bypass mode?

title: 820-00138a no green light
message: Actually there was a short on ppbus, but i thought that ppbus doesnt have anything to do with pp3v42 or green light is it?

title: 820-00138a no green light
message: Damn i feel scared to usd fake charger again, because it has blewed 5 of my dcin.. Doesnt turn on with smc bypass

title: 820-00138a no green light
message:
Fake charger shouldn't blow things if is properly connected.
If you connect it a bit angled, then you can fry SMC, be aware.
Another option is work with becch power supply, but put it on ONLY after cable has been connected to the board.

You can diagnose board problems, as fake charger and bench power supply will still supply nominal voltage, when leakage present on input stage.

Did you try another DCIN board?

title: 820-00138a no green light
message: Okay, so when i measure some caps, i found that ppdcin_chrgr is shorted to ground, I have remove q7080 and  q7010 but still shorted, I see that this line is connected somewhere else.., can i inject here?

title: 820-00138a no green light
message: Ppvin_s5_hs is shorted to ground too

title: 820-00138a no green light
message:
None of Q7010/7180 has contact with ground; how can generate a short???

So you have short on PPBUS_G3H too; means Q7130 is shorted!
Which is the exact value of the short?
Compare it with all big coils to ground.
Very likely shorted high-side MOSFET from a secondary power supply; already explained on the forum how to find it.

title: 820-00138a no green light
message: removing q7135 remove all the short.. do i need to replace anything else in one go maybe ? can i use mosfet from 820-3437 / 820-3476 maybe ? or can I use another q7130 to q7135 place from same board ?

title: 820-00138a no green light
message:
So both Q7130/35 shorted?
Better to change U7100 too.
And be sure C7125 is there and good.
You can remove the MOSFETs from other MacBook board; just be sure Q7135 has embeded Schottky diode.

title: 820-00138a no green light
message:
i got orange light now, cpu is warm, but no fan spin.., no usb activity too..
I got 20v on ppbus_g3h, is it normal ? should be 12.6 right?
i got pp5v_s5 and pp3v3_s5

title: 820-00138a no green light
message: So you didn't change Q7130 yet :(...

title: 820-00138a no green light
message:
changed q7130, but ppbus 1 v, so i change u7100 too, now board turn on and boot normally..

out of topic : i need smc for this board, do you know any where can i get that?

title: 820-00138a no green light
message:

Write him directly, as he has lot of unlisted boards.
You can get better price outside eBay, for bulk buy...
